title: 2014 AMC 10
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/RA7uNpPeg5-2014-amc10-b.PNG?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Six regular hexagons surround a regular hexagon of side length 1 as shown above. What is the area of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\triangle ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/iZzyw9PHFc-b170525.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle ADE"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a right triangle with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle DAE = 30^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AE=\cos 30^\circ = \dfrac {\sqrt 3}2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC = 4 \times \dfrac {\sqrt 3}2 = 2\sqrt 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The area of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given by:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} [ABC] & = \frac 12 AB \times AC \times \sin \angle A \\ & = \frac 12 \times 2\sqrt 3 \times 2\sqrt 3 \times \frac {\sqrt 3}2 \\ & = \boxed{3\sqrt 3} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2014 AMC 12B #18
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 are to be arranged in a circle. An arrangement is bad if it is not true that for every n from 1 to 15 one can find a subset of the numbers that appear consecutively on the circle that sum to n. Arrangements that differ only by a rotation or a reflection are considered the same. How many different bad arrangements are there? "}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We see that there are 5! total ways to arrange the numbers. However, we can always rotate these numbers so that, for example, the number 1 is always at the top of the circle. Thus, there are only 4! ways under rotation, which is not difficult to list out. We systematically list out all 24 cases. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we must examine if they satisfy the conditions. We can see that by choosing one number at a time, we can always obtain subsets with sums 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. By choosing the full circle, we can obtain 15. By choosing everything except for 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, we can obtain subsets with sums of 10, 11, 12, 13, and 14. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This means that we now only need to check for 6, 7, 8, and 9. However, once we have found a set summing to 6, we can choose everything else and obtain a set summing to 9, and similarly for 7 and 8. Thus, we only need to check each case for whether or not we can obtain 6 or 7. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We find that there are only 4 arrangements that satisfy these conditions. However, each of these is a reflection of another. We divide by 2 for these reflections to obtain a final answer of 2."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: LET US LEARN SOMETHINGNEW!!(2014)
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/39e4b06e3f.fb96549631.alP3nK.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
I deposited 2014 in HDFC bank which gives interest @ 6% per annum. So for how many years I must keep Rs. 2014 in bank so that my money gets doubled (or) comes very near to the doubled amount."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hint and Directions:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1) Let us assume I had Rs.50 with me on which I am receiving interest at particular rate, after 5 years the amount turns Rs.99.88 and after 6 years it turns up to Rs. 101."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2) Thus according to question the year in which the amount gets doubled or comes nearest to the amount when compared to other years. Hence, the answer will be 5 years and not 6 years because in five years the amount including interest has come very close."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3) The question can be cracked in less than 2 seconds, so better not use calculators!!"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The problem can be cracked by the well-renowned "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\huge{RULE OF 72}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"According to rule of 72:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A given amount will be doubled in 72/x years compounded annually where x is the interest provided on the amount."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(it is not applicable with 2% interest rate compounded for 36 years)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Just divide 72 by the interest rate, and you will get the answer as 72/6"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\huge{=12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hope, this helps all of you to really learn something new!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""KNOWLEDGE MULTIPLIES WHEN SHARED""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
